metadata.titleEn: Whole rock major and trace, zircon U-Pb isotope, mineral chemistry and Hf isotope geochemical data set of magmatic rocks in the Qinghai Tibet Plateau (Lhasa block cuomai township)
metadata.description: The data set includes major and trace elements, zircon U-Pb isotope, mineral chemistry and Hf isotope geochemical data of the whole rock from Lhasa block to cuomaixiang magmatic rock in Qinghai Tibet Plateau. The sampling time is 2015-2016, and the area is qanu area, gongcuomai Township, Gangdese, Tibet. The rock samples include 13 diorite and 14 gabbro. This data provides a key limit for understanding the initial subduction time of the Neotethys ocean, and limits the initial subduction time of the Neotethys ocean to 255-214 Ma, which is of great significance for exploring the tectonic evolution of the Tethys. The major and trace elements in the whole rock samples were measured by fluorescence spectrometer (XRF) and plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS), zircon U-Pb dating by laser ablation plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS), mineral chemistry by electron probe microanalysis (EPMA), and zircon in-situ Hf isotope by multi receiver inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC – ICP – MS), The testing units include the State Key Laboratory of metallogenic mechanism of endogenetic metal deposits in Nanjing University and the Key Laboratory of deep geodynamics, Ministry of natural resources, Chinese Academy of Geological Sciences. The data set has been published in the well-known Journal International geology review, and the data results are true and reliable.
metadata.instructions:
1. File name:
(1) The whole rock geochemical major and trace data are stored in Excel format, and the file name is "MajorTraceElement2015001.xlsx", in which MajorTraceElement represents the content, 2015 represents the year, and 001 represents the serial number.
(2) Zircon U-Pb age data are stored in Excel format, and the file name is "U-PbDating2015001.xlsx", in which  U-PbDating represents content, 2015 represents year, and 001 represents serial number.
(3) Hf isotope geochemical data are stored in Excel format, and the file name is "Lu-HfIsotope2015001.xlsx", in which Lu-HfIsotope represents the content, 2015 represents the year, and 001 represents the serial number.
(4) Mineral chemistry data are stored in Excel format, and the file names are "PyroxeneGeochemistry2015001. xlsx" and "S5-Zircon 2015001. xlsx", in which PyroxeneGeochemisty and S5-Zircon represent the content, 2015 represents the year, and 001 represents the serial number.
2. Data reading mode:
The data can be directly opened in Excel workbooks.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to gather geochemical data of igneous rocks in the Tibetan Plateau, specifically focusing on the analysis of zircon U-Pb isotopes and Hf isotopes?
Example.Answer: To gather geochemical data of igneous rocks in the Tibetan Plateau, methods such as LA-ICP-MS (Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) are used for zircon U-Pb dating, and MC–ICP–MS (Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) is utilized for analyzing in situ zircon Hf isotopes. These techniques were applied to samples from the Lhasa block in Cuomei Township, including diorite and gabbro rock samples.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the key characteristics of data collection methods used for analyzing the geochemical properties of magmatic rocks in the Tibetan Plateau?
Feature Specification.Answer: X-ray fluorescence spectrometry, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, electron probe micro-analyzer, multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Definition.Question: What does '锆石U-Pb同位素定年' mean in the context of geological data collection?
Definition.Answer: '锆石U-Pb同位素定年' refers to a dating technique used in geology to determine the age of zircon minerals by measuring the ratio of uranium to lead isotopes. This method is utilized to establish the timing of geological events, such as the initial subduction of the Neo-Tethys Ocean, and involves using laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for precise analysis.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors could influence the accuracy of zircon U-Pb isotopic dating in magmatic rocks from the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The accuracy of zircon U-Pb isotopic dating could be influenced by the precision of the laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) method used, as well as the condition and quality of the zircon samples collected from magmatic rocks in the Tibetan Plateau.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the purpose of collecting whole-rock major and trace elements, zircon U-Pb isotopes, mineral chemistry, and Hf isotope geochemistry data in the context of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau magmatic rocks?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The goal of collecting these data types is to provide key constraints on the initial subduction timing of the Neo-Tethys Ocean, limiting it to between 255-214 Ma. This information is significant for exploring the tectonic evolution process of the Tethys Ocean.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures and instruments are typically used for analyzing the whole-rock major and trace elements, zircon U-Pb isotopes, mineral chemistry, and Hf isotopes in magmatic rocks from regions like the Lhasa block in the Tibetan Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The analysis of whole-rock major and trace elements in magmatic rocks typically involves the use of X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF) and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS). Zircon U-Pb isotopic dating is conducted using laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS). Mineral chemistry is analyzed through electron probe microanalysis (EPMA), and in situ Hf isotopes in zircon are determined using multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC–ICP–MS). These methods are employed by research institutions like the State Key Laboratory for Mineral Deposits Research at Nanjing University and the Key Laboratory of Deep-Earth Dynamics of the Ministry of Natural Resources of China Geological Survey.
